params.user: Address can be 0 if heroId was already burnt at the moment of reinforcement releasing

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

returns._0: Return the guild in which the hero is staked for guild reinforcement

increaseRevision(address).details: Revision should be increased on each contract upgrade

isController(address).details: Return true if given address is controller

registerNftReward(address,uint256,addres.details: Only for dungeon. Assume the NFT already sent to this contract.

registerTokenReward(address,uint256,addr.details: Only for dungeon. Assume the tokens already sent to this contract.

params.rewardAmount: Reward required by the helper for the help.

returns.busyInGuildId: Id of the guild where the hero is being asked for help currently. 0 - free for being asked for the help

askGuildHero(address,uint256,address,uin.notice: user User which asks for guild reinforcement

askHeroV2(address,uint256,address,uint25.notice: {hero} asks help of the {helper} Hero owner sends reward amount to the helper owner as the reward for the help. Hero owner sends fixed fee to controller using standard process-routine. Size of the fixed fee depends on total number of calls of {askHeroV2} for last 24 hours since the current moment. Durability of all equipped items of the helper are reduced. Assume, that hero owner approves rewardAmount + fixed fee to reinforcementController-contract - rewardAmount: amount required by the helper (see {heroInfoV2}) - fixed fee: fee taken by controller (see {getFeeAmount})

busyGuildHelperOf(address,uint256).notice: Return the guild in which the hero is currently asked for guild reinforcement

controller().notice: Return controller address saved in the contract slot

isGovernance(address).notice: Return true if given address is setup as governance in Controller

lastGuildHeroWithdrawTs(address,uint256).notice: Return moment of last withdrawing of the hero from guild reinforcement
